dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Hill introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To encourage the timely use of funds provided under the emergency rental assistance programs administered by the Secretary of the Treasury, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Rural Renters Act of 2022.

subsection.text: Section 501(d) of subtitle A of title V of division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (15 U.S.C. 9058a(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting other than a grantee described in subsection (b)(1)(B)(i) after by a grantee; and

by adding at the end the following new sentence: The Secretary shall require that any amount of funds reallocated pursuant to this subsection from a grantee described in subsection (b)(1)(B)(i) to another eligible grantee after September 30, 2021, but that remain unobligated by such other eligible grantee as of the date of enactment of this sentence, shall be returned to the original grantee described in subsection (b)(1)(B)(i) promptly upon such date of enactment..

subsection.text: Section 3201(e) of the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 (15 U.S.C. 9058c(e)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting other than grantees described in subsection (f)(1)(A) after eligible grantees; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The Secretary shall require that any amount of funds reallocated pursuant to this subsection from a grantee described in subsection (f)(1)(A) to another eligible grantee after March 31, 2022, but that remain unobligated by such other eligible grantee as of the date of enactment of this paragraph, shall be returned to the original grantee described in subsection (f)(1)(A) promptly upon such date of enactment.
